result.disclaimer: All figures are preliminary estimates based on typical project costs

service.spacePlanningBudget: Standardized Efficiency. Application of universal ergonomic principles. Focuses on standard layouts to minimize construction complexity and decision time. Estimate Allocation: Basic design documentation fees plus essential rough construction labor (minimal demolition/rewiring).
service.spacePlanningStandard: Ergonomic Optimization. Custom zoning and spatial logic tailored to lifestyle habits. Estimate Allocation: Professional design fees plus rough construction labor (Demolition, Electrics, Plumbing).
service.spacePlanningPremium: Architectural Restructuring. Comprehensive spatial re-imagining. Includes wall reconfiguration, advanced joinery integration, and complex system planning. Estimate Allocation: Architectural design fees plus heavy structural labor (Demolition, new framing, advanced systems).
service.interiorFinishesBudget: Single-Source Selection. Materials selected from consolidated vendors or pre-set palettes to optimize costs and logistics. Estimate Allocation: Specification fees, purchase of standard materials (Laminate, Stock Tiles), and standard installation labor.
service.interiorFinishesStandard: Material Curation & Layouts. Matching textures across suppliers and creating technical tile/flooring schemes. Estimate Allocation: Design documentation fees, purchase of hard materials (Floors, Tiles), and installation labor.
service.interiorFinishesPremium: Unrestricted Sourcing. Global procurement scope. Includes rare natural materials, trade-only surfaces, and complex detailing (e.g., shadow gaps). Estimate Allocation: Detailed technical documentation fees, purchase of luxury materials, and artisan-level installation labor.
service.furnishingDecorBudget: Retail Specification. Selection of ready-to-ship, in-stock items from major retailers. Focuses on budget control and immediate availability. Estimate Allocation: Shopping list creation fees plus purchase costs for retail furniture and lighting.
service.furnishingDecorStandard: Semi-Custom Selection. A cohesive shopping list blending retail items with specific fabric/finish choices. Estimate Allocation: Styling/Sourcing fees plus purchase costs for movable furniture, lighting, and textiles.
service.furnishingDecorPremium: Bespoke Commissioning. Specification of trade-only brands and custom pieces. Includes exact sizing, custom upholstery, and made-to-measure detailing. Estimate Allocation: Procurement & management fees plus purchase costs for trade-only furniture, custom lighting, and fabrics.

mission.title: The Mission
mission.subtitle: Democratizing design, one space at a time
mission.headline: Democratizing Professional Design.
mission.paragraph1: Home renovation is one of the most significant investments a person makes—yet the process remains frustratingly opaque. Budgets spiral without warning. Contractors quote wildly different numbers. Homeowners feel lost before they've even begun.
mission.paragraph2: We believe technology can change this. By analyzing thousands of completed projects, material costs, and market rates, we've built a system that brings transparency to what has always been a guessing game.
mission.paragraph3: Our tool doesn't replace architects or designers—it empowers homeowners to approach professionals with realistic expectations, clear budgets, and a visual language for what they want. It levels the playing field.
mission.paragraph4: This is professional-grade planning, accessible to everyone. No more fear. No more surprises. Just clarity from day one.
mission.founderNote: Built by a tech founder obsessed with design.

storage.hallwayWardrobe: Is there an entrance wardrobe of at least {value}m (for coats, shoes, guests)?
storage.masterWardrobe: Is there a wardrobe run of at least {value}m in the master bedroom?
storage.kidsWardrobe: Is there a kids wardrobe run of at least {value}m?
storage.general: Is the general storage (utility wardrobe) at least {value}m?
storage.utility: Is there a dedicated spot for vacuum/mop (min 60×60cm) outside bedrooms?
storage.entryDrop: Is there a console or shelf near the front door for keys/phones?

social.diningCount: Does the dining table seat at least {value} people (including guests)?
social.chairClearance: Is there at least 80cm behind each dining chair to pull it out?
social.sofaCapacity: Does the living room seat at least {value} people (including lounging)?
social.conversation: Are armchairs/sofas facing each other (social) rather than all facing TV?
social.trafficPaths: Can you reach the kitchen/balcony without walking through the TV zone?

kitchen.linear: Is the total kitchen run (base + tall units) at least {value}m?
kitchen.tallUnits: Are there at least {value} tall storage unit(s) (pantry, fridge tower)?
kitchen.triangle: Is the sum of distances between Sink, Fridge, and Hob less than 6m?
kitchen.prepZone: Is there at least 60cm of clear countertop between the Sink and the Hob?
kitchen.aisleWidth: If there is an island, is the walkway at least 90cm wide?
kitchen.dishwasherTrap: When the dishwasher door opens, does it avoid blocking the sink user?
kitchen.fridgeDoor: Does the fridge door open towards the work zone (not blocking flow)?
kitchen.fridgeOven: Is there at least 15cm distance between the fridge and the oven?

bedroom.bedAccess: Is there at least 50cm of walking space on both sides of a double bed?
bedroom.nightstands: Are there surfaces on both sides of the bed for phones/books?
bedroom.doorConflict: When the bedroom door is open, does it avoid blocking the wardrobe?
bedroom.sightlines: When lying in bed, is the bathroom/toilet not directly visible?
bedroom.acoustics: Does the master bedroom avoid sharing a wall with the TV or kitchen?

bathroom.ratio: Is there at least {value} bathroom(s) for your household?
bathroom.doorSwing: Does the bathroom door swing outwards or slide (not inwards hitting fixtures)?
bathroom.elbowRoom: Is there at least 15cm clearance on either side of the toilet?
bathroom.showerHead: Can you turn the water on without getting wet immediately?

homeOffice.workZone: Is the desk in a dedicated zone (not on the dining table)?
homeOffice.naturalLight: Is the primary work surface receiving side-light or facing a window?

power.bedCharging: Are there power outlets reachable from both sides of the bed?
power.sofaPower: Is there at least one outlet within 1.5m of main sofa seating?
power.entryCharging: Is there a power outlet near the entry/drop zone?
power.workPower: Does the desk area have at least 2 accessible outlets?
power.taskLighting: Can kitchen prep, desk, and mirror be lit without only ceiling lights?

doors.doorToDoor: Do room, wardrobe, and bathroom doors avoid colliding when opened?
doors.applianceToPerson: Does opening appliances avoid blocking the person using the space?
doors.applianceToAppliance: Can fridge, dishwasher, oven, and drawers open simultaneously?
doors.circulationBlocking: Does any open door avoid blocking a primary walking path?

storage.hallwayWardrobe: Without adequate entrance storage, coats pile on chairs and the entry feels cluttered. Plan 0.6m per adult + 0.4m per child + 0.6m buffer for guests.
storage.masterWardrobe: Single adults need 1.8m; couples need 2.4m of hanging space to avoid morning conflicts and cluttered bedrooms.
storage.kidsWardrobe: Children need dedicated storage for clothes, sports gear, and seasonal items. Plan 0.8m per child + 0.4m shared buffer.
storage.general: General storage holds vacuum, seasonal items, bulk supplies. Plan 1.0m base + 0.4m per person.
storage.utility: Without a dedicated utility spot, cleaning equipment ends up in bedrooms or visible in living spaces.
storage.entryDrop: Without a drop zone, keys and phones scatter throughout the home, causing daily frustration.

social.diningCount: Plan for household members + 2 guest seats. Too little seating means uncomfortable gatherings.
social.chairClearance: Without 80cm behind chairs, guests struggle to sit down and traffic flow is blocked.
social.sofaCapacity: Living seating should accommodate everyone + 1 for comfortable lounging.
social.conversation: All seating facing the TV creates an antisocial layout that discourages conversation.
social.trafficPaths: Walking through the TV zone interrupts viewing and creates constant household friction.

kitchen.linear: Kitchen run of 3.0m base (for 2 people) + 0.6m per extra adult + 0.4m per child provides adequate prep, cooking, and storage space.
kitchen.tallUnits: Plan 1 tall unit (pantry/fridge tower) per 2 people for food storage and bulk shopping.
kitchen.triangle: A work triangle over 6m means exhausting extra steps while cooking. Efficiency drops significantly.
kitchen.prepZone: Without prep space near the hob, you'll be juggling hot pans and chopping boards unsafely.
kitchen.aisleWidth: Narrow aisles create traffic jams when multiple people use the kitchen.
kitchen.dishwasherTrap: A dishwasher that blocks the sink creates daily friction during cooking and cleaning.
kitchen.fridgeDoor: A fridge door that opens away from the work zone disrupts cooking flow constantly.
kitchen.fridgeOven: Placing the fridge next to the oven wastes energy and can damage the fridge compressor.

bedroom.bedAccess: Single-side access makes bed-making difficult and disturbs sleeping partners.
bedroom.nightstands: Without surfaces on both sides, one person ends up putting their phone on the floor.
bedroom.doorConflict: Doors that collide create daily annoyance and can damage furniture.
bedroom.sightlines: Direct sightline to the toilet from bed affects privacy and restful sleep.
bedroom.acoustics: Shared walls with TV or kitchen mean noise transfer disrupts sleep.

bathroom.ratio: More than 3 people sharing one bathroom creates morning rush conflicts.
bathroom.laundry: 1-3 people: bathroom-integrated. 4-5 people: dedicated niche. 6+ people: separate room.
bathroom.doorSwing: An inward-swinging door can trap someone who falls and hit fixtures.
bathroom.elbowRoom: A toilet wedged against a wall is uncomfortable to use and difficult to clean.
bathroom.showerHead: Getting wet while adjusting water temperature is an unpleasant daily experience.

homeOffice.workZone: Working at the dining table leads to mental burnout—no separation between work and life.
homeOffice.naturalLight: Back-to-window screens cause glare; side-light is optimal for work surfaces.

power.bedCharging: Without outlets on both sides, charging cables cross the bed or require extension cords.
power.sofaPower: No outlet near the sofa means trailing cables or constantly moving to charge devices.
power.entryCharging: Without entry power, devices can't charge where they're naturally dropped.
power.workPower: Too few desk outlets means extension cords and cable clutter at the workspace.
power.taskLighting: Relying only on ceiling lights creates shadows that make tasks difficult and straining.

doors.doorToDoor: Colliding doors create daily annoyance, noise, and damage to finishes.
doors.applianceToPerson: Appliances that block the user create friction during cooking and chores.
doors.applianceToAppliance: Appliances that can't open together force inefficient sequential workflows.
doors.circulationBlocking: Doors blocking walkways create constant navigation around obstacles.
